titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the San Diego Aerospace Museum collection circa 1860-1946
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Beth Goder

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-02-12T15:40-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Photographs, postcards, and miscellany, relating mainly to American participation in World Wars I and II. Collected by the San Diego Aerospace Museum.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to audiovisual materials requires at least two weeks advance notice. Audiovisual materials include sound recordings, video recordings, and motion picture film. Hoover staff will determine whether use copies of the materials requested can be made available. Some materials may not be accessible even with advance notice. Please contact the Hoover Institution Archives for further information.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], San Diego Aerospace Museum collection, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2002.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Historical Note

chronitem.event: Established when the State of California approved the articles of incorporation
International Aerospace Hall of Fame (IAHF) established
Museum moved to the Electric Building, which provided more area for display
Fire destroyed aircraft, artifacts, and archival materials
Became the first aero-themed museum to be accredited by the American Association of Museums

eventgrp.event: Name changed to the San Diego Air & Space Museum
Museum acquired the Low Speed Wind Tunnel

bioghist.p: Source: San Diego Air & Space Museum website. Accessed through http://www.sandiegoairandspace.org/

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: In 2002, the San Diego Aerospace Museum, now known as the San Diego Air and Space Museum, donated materials to the Hoover Institution Archives that matched the archives' collecting goals. The San Diego Aerospace Museum collection contains photographs and postcards mainly related to American participation in World Wars I and II.

The collection includes images from a range of conflicts, from the American Civil War to World War II. There are full-page clippings of Civil War cartoons, including drawings by Theodore R. Davis. One photo album contains images of World War I soldiers, while a photo album presented to William Korongy from the 1939-1940 New York World's Fair includes photographs of the January 28 Incident, also known as the Shanghai War of 1932.

Some of the photographs related to World War II originated from the Theodore Blaine collection at the museum. Materials include a service record detailing where Blaine was stationed, which provides context for the photographs of American soldiers in France during World War II.
Additional photographs depicting the World War II era include scenes of Italy and Southern France, which were donated to the museum by Bob Bower.

Photo album presented to William Korongy from 1939-1940 New York World's Fair,

scopecontent.p: Includes images of war, including photographs of Shanghai and conflicts between China and Japan, such as the January 28 Incident, also known as the Shanghai War of 1932. Includes loose photographs of Hawaii and World Fair ticket stub.
